articles.title: Mediterranean Diet Tied to 23% Lower Risk of Death in Landmark 25-Year Study - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Researchers at Brigham and Women's Hospital have explored and analyzed the fundamental reasons that might account for the Mediterranean diet's 23 percent decrease in overall mortality risk among American women. Researchers at Brigham and Women’s Hospital have…
articles.content: Researchers found that the Mediterranean diet reduces all-cause mortality by 23% among U.S. women, likely due to beneficial changes in metabolism and inflammation markers, emphasizing its potential f… [+5624 chars]

articles.title: T20 World Cup: From playing with Jofra Archer to hitting 10 sixes, Aaron Jones lives an American dream - Hindustan Times
